text: holiday wouldn't be complete without a
cheese platter I have three really fun
simple presentation ideas so that you
can mix it up and make it new this year
the cheese ball is perhaps the most
ubiquitous but instead of making a ball
try making a pinecone this year so what
I've done is I've taken my favorite
cheese ball recipe this one is a very
classic cheddar and cream cheese mixture
that I've chilled and divided and formed
into pine cone shapes and then all you
have to do is coat them in toasted
almonds look for the almonds with the
skins on sliced and that helps to give
that pinecone effect and what you can do
is just take your almonds and press them
into the cheese until they hear and
you'll want to do this shortly before
you plan on serving them I wouldn't put
this back into the refrigerator because
your almonds will go soft so I can go
right under the platter and then our
second guy now you could make one giant
pinecone you could make several small
pinecones whatever suits you and this is
excellent served with crackers or
crudit√© vegetables like cucumbers and
for the finishing touch on these
rosemary sprigs they mimic the branches
of a pinecone tree quite well and they
also add a nice bit of fragrance these
are looking fantastic all they need are
cheese knife and crackers and they're
ready to devour now this is my favorite
holiday tradition of all and very close
to my heart my grandparents in Texas
would always make this for the holidays
and it's so simple a block of cream
cheese cut in half on a diagonal and
then you line up the two narrow sides at
the top are you seeing a Christmas tree
yet and for the magic touch hot pepper
jelly just give a nice generous layer
right over the top of the cheese and
then this was not a part of my
grandparents Christmas tree but I
included in mine now cucumber so you'll
want to cut very thin planks and find
one of those mini cucumbers if you can
or a Persian cucumber these work best
here for the scale and you want to go
paper-thin
so that it has a translucency to it when
it's cut
that'll help give you the effect you
want and then we just line these up
Domino style on top of the tree to clean
up the edges take scissors and just trim
along the perimeter of your cream cheese
tree you can also serve slices of
cucumber alongside in addition to
crackers of course you have to have
crackers and then on top more of that
pepper jelly a nice thin layer here
because you want to see the cucumber
underneath and the little bits that are
suspended about in this jelly look like
ornaments on your tree and for the
finishing touch a cinnamon stick for the
trunk and there you have it a beautiful
festive cream cheese Christmas tree my
favorite I've saved the best for last a
relish tray wreath using fresh herbs
olives pickled cherry peppers and
bocconcini there's little mozzarella
balls so start with the rosemary and
you'll just want to manipulate your
Rosemere it so that it holds around its
shape and then take your sage leaves you
can sort of tuck them in intermittently
amongst the rosemary you can also use
oregano here marjoram any Hardy herb and
these little guys this beautiful lemon
thyme these go placed about what do you
think are you seeing a wreath yet and
then bay leaves buy fresh bay leaves if
you can they have a more vibrant green
color than the dried variety and these
are kind of fun to just stick around
popping off the tray a bit these
beautiful cherry peppers they look like
little jewels on here place these sort
of randomly about maybe we'll have five
little groupings or so and olives I love
these Castelvetrano they have a
beautiful green color those can go
around with the peppers and then
bocconcini these are just little mini
mozzarella balls they pop nicely against
all of this color on here and there you
have it for your next holiday party try
these easy elegant presentations cream
cheese Christmas tree cheddar cheese
pine
and a relish tray wreath happy Holidays
to you and yours
you
